title: Bug 9619 - Move static member: Dialog details
description:
During the move of static members (Bug 9619Move static member: Dialog details 20020212a): 

a. Mnemonics
b. There's no validation on the type field. Currently, the existence of a type is not too costly (handled in the type wizard for superclass), so it could be implemented. At the very least, it should check for isValidTypeName.
c. The browse button appears too small; consider using SWTUtil for standard button sizes.
d. The title is utilized for lengthy text. When transitioning to the next page, it displays 'Type not found'. Only types from the source folders of the own project should be visible in the dialog.
e. The destination type can be the same as the source type: during refactoring, a warning erroneously suggests errors will occur (which is untrue) and generates pseudo-changes in all referencing classes.
f. The label should state 'Select destination type:'.
OB:
1. Browse button is too small (use SWTUtil for standard button sizes).
2. The title is used for long text. When going to the next page, it says 'Type not found'. Only types from the source folders of the own project should be shown in the dialog.
3. Destination type can be source type: refactoring warns that this will result in errors (which is not true) and makes pseudo-changes in all referencing classes.
EB:
1. Utilize the title for 'Move static field(s)' and use the description for 'x fields from xx'.
2. The selection dialog should initialize with the type currently entered.
SR:
1. Open the static member move dialog.
2. Try entering a source type that matches the destination type.
3. Initiate the refactoring process and observe if warnings about resulting errors occur or if pseudo-changes are made in referencing classes.
